SVjB6G6Plyq05PIDfmuCkQ.text: Finally a great poke spot in Charlotte! If you're wanting to give Poke a try this should definitely be your first pick. (they have chicken for people who aren't into fish ) I love that you can byob or choose from signature menu. There are a variety of toppings and they are all so fresh and delicious! Also recommend saving room for desert.

-w8g7W62840qyKSOqeelpA.text: We decided to stop here on our way through downtown Charlotte.  We had a serious craving for Poke for no particular reason. It was delicious and fresh tasting. You can't go wrong with making your own Poke box. I was full 3/4 in but it was so good I ended up finishing the whole thing. The employees were nice and ready to help when you had questions. I would highly recommend Pokeatery for anyone who is looking for a tasty, fresh, and healthy meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon, tuna, shrimp, spicy crab, seaweed salad, rice, spicy crab salad, and edamame

ymuiuE5C7SX85QRcOfN1Sg.text: This was a great place to get a great Poke bowl. The are lots of options to choose. You can try the signature boxes or Build your own. You can choose four scoops of Protein from a  great selection of fish (Ahi Tuna, Albacore Hamachi, Salmon, Spicy Tuna), shrimp, chicken or vegetarian. Lots of great sauces and veggies to add to your bowl. Ant to top it off after you finish, you can grab a Dole Whip.

jdy3mfduIkiCgty1b6l6nQ.text: I was lucky enough to stumble upon this great new spot! Service was great, I chose from many options for the Poke Box, and the fish quality and portion size were great.   I travel a lot and have had Poke from several different cities. Pokeatery ranks among the best.   I missed out on the dole whip so I'll be back again for that.

AJ1tjt2teml8mIKLOGSxLA.text: Just stopped in here for the first time and will definitely be back. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Of all the poke places that are currently in Charlotte, this one is the best in my opinion. They have great flavors and the most options for toppings and bases!

pBeDDj4wKWVfhJr-FqptGA.text: Poke enthusiasts! This place is an absolute must if you stay near or in the uptown Charlotte area! My girlfriend and I went here on a whim to try out their poke bowl and I must say, it was 100% worth it! Inviting atmosphere, generous portions on all the proteins, unlimited toppings (a whole bunch to select from) and super fresh!  Even though I've been to all the poke spots I could think of in Charlotte, this one by far is on top of the list!  Not only that, the owner, Lee came by and introduced us to other ingredients on the menu that was new to us. Also don't forget to check in on Yelp to get yourself a free miso soup! Definitely worth every bite!

yXHjgDGnlsdyiZMf6JNa9Q.text: Delicious. A bit pricey for lunch during a work day but also you get a ton so it's worth, just wont be everyday. Staff was super friendly too. I'll definitely be back.

3aMqZqM_RMNHd8ABalkt2g.text: Had a great experience at this poke spot located in the epicenter. They had quite a few ingredients that were new to me and the staff was helpful and knowledgeable about the items I wasn't sure about. I went with the "surfer" one of the bowls on the menu and was not let down. Ingredients were fresh made to order right in front of you. I will be returning to try other creations from the menu or even build my own bowl.

ixHMSABggMGHcbeRNtygMw.text: I came in at lunch to order bowls for my coworkers.  The service was great, all 5 were made fast and accurately.  The entire team loved them.  The amount of food is crazy and they have so many options! The fish was very fresh. Cucumber salad had the perfect amount of flavor; not too acidic. It was also nice for the non sushi eaters to enjoy the chicken and shrimp offered.  I will definitely be back to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

PIzzikVsakPY43BNR-CLgQ.text: This is the perfect place for an amazing Poke bowl. I'm not a huge fish eater but love Tuna. They do have options for chicken and veggie for those who don't eat fish, so don't rule out trying this place if you don't eat seafood! There were so many topping options and everything was soooo full of flavor and super fresh. Lastly don't forget your ice cream for desert. I can't wait to go back when they have their cocktail list and mimosas!

BS-MmcJuPDFTEKh8FqTW2w.text: Great new place in the epicenter downtown for poke.  I had never heard of this type of food but was pleasantly surprised by what they have to offer.  Any sushi lover or healthy eater will appreciate the selection and the novelty that is poke in Charlotte.  Lots of options to choose from to create your own bowl or, if you're like me and never heard of poke before, there are signature bowls that don't require any decisions and are delicious the way they come!!  I had the volcano crunch bowl and the spice was on point!  Very fresh tasting ingredients and clean restaurant so I will definitely be making this a regular lunch spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

kcWhrZwjKhg8hmOicGNJ7A.text: Great spot downtown! Unique menu, friendly service!

s2kYPKe6VV4a7BrXJ2bg2w.text: Really good poke! Good selection of toppings for a good price. Very fresh and generous amounts of toppings. Also have interesting choices as the base (I tried the kelp noodles and was pleasantly surprised at how crunchy and good they were)! Definitely recommend as a quick stop for lunch or dinner in uptown

YxEFKYPlUpKg7KykM_wNaA.text: I just tried this new place and it was amazing! I created my own bowl with salmon and shrimp, but they did have chicken as an option for those that don't like fish. All the ingredients were fresh and there were a lot choices to make it what you want. It's nice to have this healthy option in the epicenter and to get my sushi fix quick and easy! I will definitely be coming back a lot!

L9fMZsy4k9gOk6p4LIvbxQ.text: I came here on a visit to Charlotte and had the make-your-own box with ahi, hamachi, and albacore tuna and the house sauce mixed with spicy mayo and loved it! They let you pick up to four proteins which is good for my indecisiveness. Generous portions, fresh food, and they'll even let you taste an ingredient if you ask. I recommend the spicy edamame salad as a side and the pineapple-strawberry dole whip for dessert. Decor is super modern and fresh looking. Great new place!

Lgr3ygFa3h5r6m5MjNm_CQ.text: This new restaurant at the Epicentre was fantastic! Everyone was so nice and very helpful because I have never been to a Pokeatery and I wanted to try something different.  They had lots of selections when making your Poke Bowl and were very patient with me since it was my first time. Then to top it off you have to have the Dole Whip for dessert. It was so refreshing and hit the spot after eating dinner. I will definitely be back and bring more family and friends.

EKfIALDYYo_XLY-624Ulnw.text: Great place, love the food. Fresh fish, reasonable prices, and delicious pineapple sorbet

tLsaAFhqP6LnsDkv7pqNuA.text: This place is awesome! They give you large portions, and I love the concept of being able to customize everything, fresh and good quality fish. Inventive and generous toppings. Attentive service and reasonable prices. Please don't change any of that!

QPfvQ6gIK7R-ZjMy2csdww.text: This was a great dining experience.  The food and the service was excellent.  I will definitely be going back.

B2jSzvmuoLVu6mhVT2Xjvg.text: Great place for a healthy and filling lunch or dinner in uptown. Fresh food like this is hard to come by. Will definitely be visiting again

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

lRo_-N2fuQaeXADoTi_7ZQ.text: Good sized servings, many things to select from, fresh taste, patient nice employees and best of all they serve limited alcoholic beverages (which must be consumed on site). Plenty of seating. Conveniently located on the 2nd floor of the epicenter across from Jason's Deli. Has a couple large flat screen TVs on mute.

DGAvU5K-3ekGtUrCHF-rbw.text: This is the best poke bowl place I have ever been, probabaly in my entire life. I literaly came here two times in a row, and will definitely come here more often in the future, I feel there are a lot of combinations for me to try. Plus located in epic center, close to everywhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. This place offer the best poke bowl i have ever tried, I came here twice in a row, and probably more often in the future

fmTImsv3DUrhXbu_Km2CHQ.text: You could literally eat at Pokeatery every day for a week and never have the same thing twice. The combinations are endless, each ingredient choice is fresher and more delicious than the next. Best poke in Charlotte by far! Oh... and they have dole whip.

e6Qqv0HVSBlSBbSsg-5hUw.text: Great food and lots of it. Should have split into two meals but it was so good I couldn't stop. Hurting now but it was worth it. Got the Surfer this time. The Volcano packs some heat for those who like spicy food, but everything is customizable.

3PGwvyiUTb3cRG78j5Lvcw.text: 1st time here. The employees were helpful in making selections for my own Poke Box with their awesome crab salad, cucumber salad, cooked shrimp mixed with a Wasabi Citrus sauce, mixed greens and sushi rice! It was delicious!  Price is good for the amount of and quality of the food! Ending my meal with their refreshing no fat Dole Whip hit the spot! You can get it topped with fresh pineapple too

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

QExgx7_jodwrICogaofUXA.text: This place is pretty awesome.   You get to completely customize your bowl to exactly what you like.  I had both spicy and regular crab salads and both were excellent.  Will definitely be back.

sYrtArbwlQ9GjJ7dqYBunA.text: Best poke I've ever had. Ingredients are fresh, place is clean, and staff is friendly. I got one of their signature bowls, the volcano crunch, mmm Poke heaven! I also tried the strawberry  guava canned drink which was a perfect sweet refreshing pairing with my spicy goodness. I will be back to build my own bowl and try their miso soup!

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. 2nd floor in the epicenter
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great atmosphere

zQSekze5tVW-z4dCbrrU_g.text: I'll start by saying POKE is my FAVORITE thing ever! I eat it at least once a week... you could probably call me obsessed! I was so excited for this place to open up but after my first experience I wasn't overall that impressed. They offer one size and it's HUGE which just isn't very lunch friendly. They also break up the ingredients and only let you mix in a few things then add the rest down the line... some of the toppings I would want mixed in are at the end. I know they are on the new side and maybe the employees will gain confidence with the ingredients but I asked about a few things and the employees seemed confused. I think they have a huge market because people are so into Poke right now but they are quite expensive. I think they need to caterer a little more to the lunch crowd since they are in the Uptown area and to do that they need to offer a smaller size. Please swap the order of your line around and put the ingredients before the sauce maker. I'll try it again in a few months to see if they have improved but for now I'm loyal to Poke Bar!

zqTBHsHfiHv24fWUdDqIbg.text: Omg. I love this place! Endless options. I'm a saucy girl and there were plenty of sauces and toppings to chose from. Only thing I would possibly do differently during my next visit is maybe ask for more rice and instead of getting 4 proteins maybe go with 2. But I really enjoyed my bowl. Portions are great. I ate off of my bowl twice. Will definitely be back to try the dole whip(?).

ZAGlc-1rvnURhDrnya-07A.text: Place was amazing. Excellent selection paired with excellent service. Would go back whenever I'm in the area.

roCP3Dwv7fEvjOi3EtHwQQ.text: Best poke joint in CLT!  Big portions. The volcano crunch hit the spot.  If you're still hungry after your poke bowl, make sure to get some miso soup and the pineapple dole whip for dessert.  Highly recommend checking them out.

lO5lPnnxpJ4kDm6Yy82O_A.text: Stumbled upon Pokeatery during their soft opening. This place is awesome!! The ahi tuna and salmon were really fresh and the portions were much larger than what I have received at other poke restaurants.There were lots of toppings to choose from and the staff even offered for me to taste the ones I was unfamiliar with. The signature hot sauce was the perfect spice level and very flavorful. This will definitely be a regular spot for lunch!

9BXGmOT2GME9OJq-pya7ww.text: Num num num!  The poke box I got here was so good! I did a make your own with tuna and salmon. Lots of options for toppings! It comes with two sides too! Spicy edamame and crab salad is on point.

u9nK_rBbsJEhqNqEDLU2ng.text: This place is wonderful. I'm glad to have it in the uptown Charlotte. I hope it can serve some hot food in the winter time.

m8avgRkMxciuCPkUpxh1Ww.text: Best poke in town-- affordable and large portions, so many options and the best, chic vibes.

a9II1cn_u_JNimrasP7Qxg.text: Perfect spot for lunch. Lot of options to choose from and pair with different sauces.

WEQGklWvBeZbIiL9imarOw.text: Great poke place uptown, the staff is super friendly and definitely go the extra mile for you. You have to stop in if not for the poke bowls, for the dole whip!

Oa__pMYLhBc83GIf55dB3Q.text: So much food for the money! I wouldn't recommend going for the first time during a busy lunch hour, there are so many toppings to choose from and you feel rushed to pick what you want. I got a bowl from the menu (it also comes with two sides, I got edamame and spicy crab salad) but you are able to substitute as you'd like. Overall, such a great lunch spot.  The pineapple whip is just as good as the actual whip I had from the Dole farm in Hawaii and from Disney. So get it.  The only thing I'd do different if I was them - the cup they give you for water is a shot glass size so I'd put out a water dispenser so customers don't have to keep coming up to the counter for water, especially during a lunch hour rush.

49Edih-b-18dlPMEnmiveA.text: Ordered the volcano crunch and OMG it is so good!! Filling but in a healthy way... The add ons are delicious!!!! Will definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

sMfbIsUWp2i2YP9Wit7BhQ.text: I don't get Uptown much anymore during the day so when I had a break between meetings I went a wandering (first on Yelp and then on foot) to see what might be fresh and new for lunch.  I wound up at Pokeatery in Epicenter and after perusing the menu, ordering and eating, all I could think is, "So where were you when I used to office Uptown on the regular?!?".    My experience was being served by a row of friendly faces all who had "Trainee" on their name tags and all of whom had clearly been well-trained.  There were no hiccups in the process and I quickly was served a box prepared just as I ordered it.  Tried one of their signature boxes and since I like heat, it was the Volcano Crunch version.  It delivered nicely both on heat as well as overall textures and flavors.  The fish and shrimp was quite fresh which is obviously priority #1 for a Poke joint.  I very much enjoyed every bite.  Assuming this is a chain by the looks of it but if it is, as time has rolled on that does not necessarily mean "stay away" like it used to back in the day.  Chain or not, it's worth the time and money.

430zedfnHxsyjEqgGoo6Xg.text: Really excited to have a dedicated poke place in uptown! While they're currently in the soft opening phase (grand opening in January), I was pleased all around with my first experience.   I went in about 1 PM on a Tuesday & there was only one person in line. You chose either prefixed poke bowls or you can make your own. Two helpful ladies behind the counter get all your decisions together in a nice little container.  Quite pricey lunch ... mine was $12.95, avocado is $1.00 extra.  I enjoyed everything, but the seaweed salad taste was off, for me. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't the best, either. Perhaps an off day for it.  Good deal of seating for those that want to dine in. Clean & atheistically pleasing.  I'll definitely continue to dine here.

1ICZ_49JVLiOVS8lQiWMYg.text: Stopped into PokeEatery for a quick lunch. The place is nice, clean, and crisp looking. It was a late lunch time so there wasn't a long line.  I will have to say that I think this take on poke is a little unique compared to all the other places. It's more compartmentalized, which I like. I went with the kids portion, which was a perfect price and size for lunch. Came with two proteins and a side. For my side, I got spicy edamame and my proteins were ahi tuna and spicy tuna. I added loads of other toppings and sauces making it super delish and for me. I do love that they don't charge extra for additional toppings (besides avocado) and sauces so you can really mix and match!  Everyone working was very helpful. Definitely will be added to my lunchtime eating out rotation!

N99KPnvxM7qcbP6LFPvjMQ.text: Yum! I'm not into raw fish, but they have options for everyone! It's like sushi in a bowl, but better.    I like how you can pick your own fresh ingredients or pick from the menu of an already designed bowl.  I tried the white rice, cucumber salad, crab salad and shrimp.  The shrimp was cooked.  I topped mine off with spicy mayo, original sauce, avocado, corn, cilantro, jalapeno.  So good   The location is great, right in the epicenter on the second floor.  Everything is so clean inside.  I definitely recommend coming and can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

izbK4-pXC56sgWDK0Fp1zQ.text: A little pricy for lunch, but quick and delicious. I will definitely be back. It is a great healthy option and welcome food diversity to Uptown. I made my own bowl and found the ingredients to be fresh and tasty. Being able to pair rice and the citrus Kale was a filling and tasty move. I think that it is a more filling (for me) and more diverse form of sushi as I was able to take bites of different things at once instead of shoving a piece in my mouth all at once trying to keep a roll together. A check in on Yelp currently nets you free Miso soup.

J8Ed0qaL_NGQ9KcMmJMGkA.text: Checked this place out for their grand opening which was cool. They walked down the line with samples of their pineapple soft serve and had giveaways on the inside (I got a mug).  Once inside the place has a nice set up with a good amount of seating but it is pretty small compared to the other food places in the epicentre. At my turn I did the BOGO offer they had and decided to go for two of their signature bowls which were the Surfer and the Workout.  I got them both actually how they came, but when it came to the sauces the girl didn't want to give me extra when I asked. So I asked again, she finally put the smallest bit more and said "ugh it's too much" under her breath. And I think that made the biggest difference in my bowls because they were bland and might as well didn't have any sauce on them because I definitely didn't taste any wasabi citrus, I couldn't tell you in the slightest what their signature sauces tasted like, and I didn't even get the drizzle of spicy mayo. In my pictures you can't even tell sauce is on it. I ended up just making my own sauces to go on it when I got home. The only good thing I liked was the spicy crab salad & the seaweed salad. I also got the free miso soup for checking in on Yelp & it was just as bland as ever. So for the checkin definitely go with the Dole whip because that was really good and taste like fresh pineapples. Overall I was highly disappointed in all the blandness of the food and most likely won't go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Workout
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Surfer
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yelp checkin offer

61EwJvR_ZTl_JyGDczHHtg.text: I dropped Pokeatery on a Wednesday for lunch.  I went with citrus kale and mixed greens base, all the mix ins and salmon and tuna with a variety of toppings.  I chose the house sauce for the poke bowl and a side of miso soup.   The poke bowl was fresh and very tasty.  The citrus kale was a great option.  The sauce was pretty mild - I would either ask for extra or add another sauce for some additional flavor.  The miso soup was essentially onion water.  There was no miso flavoring to it - it was truly inedible.  I'm assuming there was just something off about how it was prepped that day -- but, I probably won't take that chance again.   Overall, the poke was great - I love healthy options for lunch uptown!

hxZ9TS4_0zFj6whqyLY32A.text: One of my go to places for lunch uptown. Price is high but it is in the EpiCenter. The line goes by pretty fast since everything is already made and cooked. My protein choice is chicken and I always build my own bowl. So many side items o choose from. The signature sauce is my sauce of choice. The miso soup isn't bad. The pineapple dole is delicious and refreshing on a hot day. Definitely check them out if you are in the area.

izcBUrjA83TdiUNJMv2Yaw.text: Great casual spot with fresh fish, lots of options, and huge portions. For just 12.95 you get 4 scoops of protein with unlimited toppings essentially

t_YWdSkF69Nr1ANC8narNQ.text: I had heard and read that this place was good, but "Wow!!". I wanted to try it after visiting Hawaii and California and having poke in both places.  I "built my own box", but only because they have so many delicious signature boxes!  Try one, you won't be sorry!  The food was amazing, and not only because the number of choices and combinations are seemingly endless.  The freshness of the proteins was a big factor, but the sides, sauces and toppings combine to make a nearly limitless selection possible.  I want to come back again and again to try it all!  And save room for dessert.  The Dole whip (like pineapple soft serve) is AMAZING!  Definitely will be back after - you should try this place!!  PS I also was treated great by the staff and managers.  The helped me through the whole process and the result was YUM!

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dole whip for dessert
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Come before the Friday lunch crowd!!
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. This was my lunch today - colorful and delicious!!

H3swDRttYZFzpAWywGEaIA.text: This was the most disgusting poke bowl place I have ever tried to eat at. I got  door dash delivery from this place and I put this food right in the trash. The "ahi tuna" was chopped into 1 cm bits and every single piece had fat on it and it was old. The "spicy tuna" was a ball of mush with no taste and old as well. The smell of the fish was appalling ...The cucumbers were mushy. Also, the chicken looked like imitation meat... no flavor and it didn't even look like real chicken. The only thing that was semi decent was the miso soup... I will never get food from here ever again. Never recommend.

zk5eu-aQ5BBHE_D_UPVu9g.text: Build your own bowl concept with poke!  The food was very fresh and well portioned.  They offer the usual assortment of fish, rice and sauces.  In addition they offer dried and fried toppings which was unique and quite delicious.  A selection 'sides' is also available and ice cream for dessert.  Delicious!!!

p1JhO5t7bArGod153YKjWw.text: 'A nice edition to the epicenter shopping area. The food is fresh with a lot of options to customize. They even have chicken if you're afraid of the raw fish. There are drink options and also frozen yogurt for desert. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

KIqtRpJy6ChyoAMv5dn8hA.text: Was an amazing place in the Epicenter. My 11 year old son always wanted to try poke and this was the perfect place. If you are on the fence def go. It is worth it.

RzjRjrV6nnhb2jmjCzV_xg.text: We tried this place last night and it was absolutely delicious!! I did a make-your-own poke bowl and also got the pineapple dole whip and they were both incredible! It was a lot of food though so next time I may try a kids poke bowl instead. The staff working there was very friendly and the place has a cool Hawaiian vibe. We will be back and recommend to others!

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

YOpb2Y60Glv9uICn6nWh-A.text: Came here for a healthier lunch option while this place was in its early opening days. The two workers who put together the meals were in training. I had The Workout (brown rice, kelp noodles because they ran out of citrus kale, cucumber, green onion, white onion, seaweed salad, spicy garlic edamame, ahi tuna, salmon, hamachi, albacore, spicy mayo sauce, pickled ginger, massage, edamame beans, furikake, and wasabi, $12.95). The price is high, especially considering that there are several other poke spots in Charlotte to compete with. I was also told to "like" them not their Facebook page in order to also receive a free small bowl of miso soup. The ingredients were fresh and tasty. I would have preferred to have only shelled edamame instead of a mix of both edamame still in the shell and also edamame that had already been shelled. It just doesn't seem to make sense to have both. I also would have preferred to have the wasabi on the side instead of touching all the other ingredients. The miso soup was a great addition. Can't wait for the official grand opening!

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Workout

guVw2qO7_ZVrLzmbEEWiFQ.text: Delicious and fresh food.  First off the staff were friendly and helpful in deciding the best way to build a bowl.  The tuna, salmon, and spicy tuna were very fresh with big chucks of each.   I would also recommend putting the spicy crab salad in your bowl, added the perfect amount of spice to the dish.  I also added the wasabi citrus sauce to my bowl. The portion sizes are big, so you will not leave feeling hungry, like at most other poke restaurants I have eaten at.  The strawberry and pineapple ice cream was some of the best I've had as well.   I will definitely be returning to eat at this restaurant.

_94bQr5gJ0ZfIbwtuDCiOw.text: Yummy!   Excited to try this at their Grand Opening today.   Nice staff.  Great looking food

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

3xuPL_NvPplYFDau5mpyEQ.text: I've been here many times but today may be the last. The portion size was about half what it used to be yet the price was the same. The flavor/quality has diminished as well.

xGOnsSiMFsCW3KJ7QWbSZQ.text: Had to work uptown for the day so I decided to try this place out! The food was better than I expected it to be! If you are a sushi lover you will definitely enjoy this place! I love the way you get to create your own bowl! If you are in the mode for something different, you should try this place out! Not something I would eat often but I will definitely be back!

DHSt9C8zJMJi8ueqlphAew.text: I was craving poke and did a quick Yelp search. With over 70 reviews coming in at a 4.5 average, I knew this place had to be good. And it didn't disappoint!   The regular portion was very filling! It comes with 4 proteins and 2 sides. I doubled up on the ahi tuna and salmon. Sides I did the cucumber salad and spicy edamame. Don't let the word spicy scare you if you don't like heat, it's pretty mild. The citrus kale is bomb and a great base option if you're looking for an alternative to rice.  Love how customizable it is and the number of options! I will be back!!!  It is hard to find as someone else mentioned. It's on the second floor near Moes and Smoothie King.

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

j16Yl7W-pE6wcnB9_HZE6Q.text: I now live in a world with just a little less happiness. Thank you Pokeatery for bringing me to my senses.   I LOVED diving into a bowl of luscious, sweet fish, covered with some spicy sriracha mayo, refreshing cucumbers, carrots, rice, greens, soy and avocado (or whatever flavor we tossed on that day). It was a bad relationship. I'd come out craving poke... the next day, and the next...and the next.   I know it's bad, but I once poke'd for 10 days straight. We never had any issues, no matter where we ate. We shared times with friends, with family, at the movies, late night downtown, at the beach, and, oh gawd, the intimate time in front of the fireplace.   Well, no more.  Pokeatery has single-handedly crushed my poke passion.   Flavorless. Mushy. Poor quality fish. And well...just really not done well.

HDeBIcfXj3lWOOB4OT3_HQ.text: Solid poke, great portions  I was in Charlotte for a week and came here twice. They have a large variety of bases, toppings, sauces and you get to pick 4 proteins! Both experiences were solid. Added bonus: they serve Dole whip! (Free with Yelp check in!)

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dole whip
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Make your own

8CO62H5qCNL_Bepc3OlUCA.text: Slightly confusing menu, but the staff are super helpful with describing their sauces and mix-ins. It's a good portion, and everything was very fresh. I like that the rice was cold, and they use biodegradable containers. They also have real Hawaiian can drinks which are hard to find. Located in the Epicenter, it is very clean and welcoming. We will definitely be back!

kRZO7nKjUdLXMFFBQ8GWfw.text: Awesome establishment! Service is friendly and helpful, fish is fresh, toppings are plentiful and delicious, what else do you need?? I've loved everything I've gotten here, especially the tuna. The bowls are a bit pricey but it's worth it for the quality ingredients. I loved the dole whip I got for free by checking in on yelp. I really want to try a frose soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna and salmon on greens

CSRQMpE8icWOiB5r2zKfDQ.text: I love poke so I definitely wanted to try this place when it opened. When we saw their grand opening deals we decided it was a good time to try it.   We got there about 30 minutes before they opened and made it within the first 100 that got a free poke bowl. It was a long wait, but they were moving through the line quickly.   The have some of the best variety of toppings compared to the other poke places in Charlotte which I loved. I got a citrus kale base which was really good. 4 proteins seems like a lot, but their scoops are very small, so I do feel like you don't get a ton there.   It's Chipotle style build your own bowl with suggested bowls like most other poke places. They also have Dole whip for free if you check in on Yelp. They let us upgrade them to floats. They were good for a few sips, but way too sweet. I think it would have been better if it weren't dairy free so that it wouldn't be pure sugar. They also have pokado toast which sounded good but we didn't try.   Everyone working there was very friendly and there were fun free giveaways for the grand opening.   We both really enjoyed our poke bowls. I would definitely come back again, especially over the other food choices in the epicenter.

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dole whip float
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

5-ru3bkE1WDARHvJMxSFEQ.text: I'm a huge fan of poki and while visiting Charlotte I decided to try out this place.  Pretty much the same setup as the places I have tried at home and some but not all the same choices. They get pretty busy around lunch time so there was a little backup. The food was so-so but to be fair I was comparing it to the first and only place I go to in New Mexico. What is amazing is their Dole Whip! It is non dairy which my stomach can attest to. Their poki not bad at all but it wasn't to die for but I'm pretty sure many will like it and many already do but this is my taste buds talking.

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

ahdkXzUfUDj-t_AN_mw9pw.text: Had to think long and hard about how to rate this place. Definitely want it to succeed because it is the only poke bowl venue in Uptown and I love being able to walk to my grindz. On the other hand, my poke-native standards refuse to let me incorporate hope into the mix. This place was a three. Good enough to satisfy a desperate craving but nothing I could bring a friend to without embarrassment.   Went initially for lunch but the line was so long I gave up and went to Hibachi across the way. When I went back in the evening, it was less crowded but still not fast. The service felt like that scene from "Dude Where's My Car?" with an endless line of bored faces saying, "An den? An den? An den an den an den!" I was particularly miffed by one staff member who went through the motion of sprinkling furikake on my bowl, looked down to see that ZERO furikake had come out of the shaker, shrugged and put the shaker down and gave me that "Next?" look. Um, no. I want my furikake. Paying was easy although it seemed like getting a fountain drink or froyo might be troublesome. They have Hawaiian Sun, just do that.   How was the food? Well, I was glad to see the variety. But the fish was soggy. Like it had been frozen a long time. That's a serious no-no in my book. And the kelp was bitter (better warm than cold anyway), and the limu was slimy. Again, more no-no's. But the brown rice was steaming and they had furikake (which I eventually got after making a little scene...). The crab salad (imitation crab and mayo) was interesting and abundant and my companion thought that was the highlight of the meal. Not a good sign, folks. No one got sick and it was a brightly lit place and the flavors are reminiscent of home. Not, you know, amazing, but will combat the homesickness in a car-free pinch.   It was expensive for the quality, a decent quantity once you account for the sides (not the amount of actual sashimi), and the location cannot be beat. I'm going to use my free miso/Dole whip coupon in the spring to give them another try, see if they've figured out the service and texture things. It's not poke, but about what you might expect for the Mainland: Subway style sashimi in sauce with sides.

crTVjx9GTRYE3gqyIAFsew.text: Came here during their official grand opening and stood outside in a huge line in the freezing cold for almost two hours! The line was extremely long and I saw many people walk away after waiting 30+ minutes. I'm so glad I wasn't one of them!   The food here is amazing. Options options options. I'm a sucker for buffets because I love options and this place is right up my alley. Just has much better quality than buffets.   This was my first taste of Poke and I'm not a fan of raw fish but since there were other protein options, I gave it a try. So amazed by how delicious it all is.  I chose BYO and put all the appetizing items on it. The ordering process  is just like that of Chipotle where you get to see them make your bowl. Everything looked and tasted delicious. Well except for the miso soup. I didn't like it. There wasn't any seaweed in the soup, just a couple macerated pieces of soft tofu and green onions in a bland broth. Luckily it was free with my Yelp check in so no harm done. I still give this place 5 stars for the amazing food. Tip: if you like spice, try a blend of wasabi citrus and spicy ono sauce. Sooooo goooood!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

hCmYoOThwyuoUjV9kP30BA.text: Aloha!!! The greeting you'll get from the staff when you walk in!  I didn't 't have high expectations but they totally exceeded them.  I built my own bowl which was fun.  The steps are up on up on the wall and are extremely easy to follow.  HUGE portions and I am totally full.   So happy this is a new option in Uptown for lunch.  Was getting tired of the boring basic sandwich options whenever I needed to grab lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. So much food!!

1z3HRA3Bvk2puJQEG9Q25A.text: Ok so I was a little skeptical to eat at a POKE place in Epicenter. All I can think of when I walk into Epicenter is college kids/drinking/hot mess express. However, I saw the great Pokeatery reviews and decided to tried it for lunch! I'm so happy I did!   The place was super clean and welcoming! The staff greeted us as soon as we walked in. They had plenty of options to pick from - including BYO and pre-made bowls- they have had a little grab and go section.   I decided to go with BYO and was surprised on how many add ins it included! Here's a break down of what I got all for $12.95: -White rice  -Two scoops ahi tuna (note I love spicy tuna, but there's is not chunked here - I'm not a fan of that but my co-worker was all about it) -Two scoops salmon  -Seaweed Salad -Spicy Crab -Cucumbers -Edamame  -Cilantro (I love lots!) -Mango -Roe -Sesame Seeds -Topped with citrus soy/Himalayan sea salt -Side of spicy mayo  Dear god that was alot but the flavors were so good and the fish was fresh. Although it's a little pricey for a quick lunch, I thought the value was so worth it! I could not finish my meal and would rate it highlight as one of the top new Poke places in CLT.  I will definitely be back for lunch, and I hope it lasts! We needed a place like this in the city for lunch!   Note: they also have DOLE WHIP and it's free with your Yelp check-in. I noticed after the fact... and they also do online/call ahead orders if you're picking up or in a rush!

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. BYO menu
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. BYO bowl. $12.95. So many options!

xyLMW65c11TbGyWmwbwo3Q.text: Well FINALLY my 1st time having a Poke Bowl... I love raw tuna very much but don't have it as often as I would like because I get worried eating raw fish from just anywhere!  I will start off by everything looked and taste extremely Fresh especially the TUNA! I will say that being our 1st timers the staff didn't seem interested in helping us understand the concept or how to get it started...we even asked a couple times and told them it was our 1st time having Poke. They spoke very quickly and quietly.  The Place was Very clean and loved they gave us a free Miso Soup for our check in on yelp. The miso soup was very flavorful...would love this on a chilly day or even when not feeling well. Just wish I would have looked into more before I went because it's laid out like Subway, so it was a little confusing to my husband and I. So I just decided on the Original Bowl

5dQd11CpeAV-CE3wbmbpaA.text: Pokeatery is located on the second floor of the EpiCenter (near the Insomnia cookies). Location is nice and clean. Workers were very helpful and nice. I have zero complaints about service. I ordered one of the pre set bowls (The workout $12.95). I was really bummed out about the quality of the fish and how incredibly over sauced it was. I didn't feel like the flavors were complimentary at all. It was actually overwhelming and not light with a focus on the fish.

wFta1PwUi3Jw4qdER_BGmQ.text: Let me be honest, I really was unsure if I wanted to eat at Pokeatery. I rarely step out of my comfort zone and do not enjoy foods with unusual textures (e.g. sushi). Nevertheless, my boyfriend swore I would enjoy Poke. Pokeatery is in a great location in the epicenter and has a sleek look. The employees were kind, answered all my questions, and were very patient. My boyfriend ordered a classic bowl and I ordered the volcano crunch bowl (I love spicy food). Additionally, I ordered the strawberry cucumber lemonade. It took me awhile to overcome the texture (I preferred the smaller chunks of ahi tuna over the bigger chunks), but overall I really liked it. I especially enjoyed the white rice's and strawberry lemonade's flavor. My boyfriend and I decided we would definitely come here again. However, I believe I would just order the same thing and not branch out any further!

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Volcano Crunch Signature Box

_bg7R2HXcKTqgAw4c_HKGQ.text: Came here to check out the new Froze beverage... also couldn't resist trying their Poke Bowl.  The Froze was good but I rather just have the soft serve!  The poke was also tasty.  I got the volcano roll (it is VERY VERY spicy, so consider this your warning). But it is delicious! I will be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Froze and Pineapple Whip
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Volcano Bowl

NVIQQ-rgQ7fBEYcY_5zdsA.text: I had high hopes for this new poke place in Uptown; it's located upstairs on the 2nd floor of the center right in front of the bridge to Bank of America Plaza.  Hopefully that helps because I wandered around for a good while looking for this place.  The lines weren't crazy during a weekday lunch rush hour.  I checked in on Yelp for a free miso soup (basically instant miso soup where they hit a button and soup comes out into a cup - yikes) or a free Dole whip (I had a sample and the REAL Dole whip is infinitely better).  Service is efficient.  Workers seemed friendly enough.  You build your own bowl here or you can choose to have one of their signature bowls on the menu.  I built my own with citrus kale, mixed greens, spicy (imitation) crab, seaweed salad, hot signature sauce, a bunch of toppings, and 4x salmon (you get 4 proteins for the regular size bowl).  At first taste, my initial reaction was "this tastes like food poisoning ready to happen".  The fish was super fishy tasting and obviously did not taste fresh.  I had just tried Ohana Poke the week prior and their fish quality was much better.  It also had absolutely ZERO taste to it.  I didn't watch them put the sauce in the bowl, but I do remember them asking me which one so I assume they put some in there, but it was so bland that I had to douse soy sauce on the fish.  I've never had bland poke anywhere.  Isn't that the point of poke in the first place - that it's well marinated?  Otherwise you might as well chop up some sashimi and put it in a salad and call it a day.  Very, very disappointing.  They also put a ridiculous amount of crab salad on your plate.  Even the people behind me were making faces when they saw that it was a giant ice cream scoop of imitation crab which was not tasty in my opinion.  The "citrus" kale had some weird white creamy sauce all over it that didn't taste like anything, let alone citrus.  I really wanted this place to work out so I could have more lunch options in Uptown, but probably the worst poke I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

DD3QGezVhNs9f244nDSK5w.text: This place offered a great variety of ingredients for poke bowls! You could build your own or choose from their list of signature bowls. I tried the "Workout" bowl and was very pleased. It included 4 different types of protein. Definitely recommend!

ghBf1YwwsznoX_uOp71xYg.text: We stopped in to pick up two bowls to go on Sunday. I was the only person at the restaurant and I was given the full attention of the girl working the counter. She was patient with me while I created my build your own bowls. The portions were generous! I also grabbed a Dole Whip because how am I supposed to resist a frozen pineapple treat?? $33 for two build your own bowls with avocado and the Dole whip. If I'm back uptown and craving a little sushi, I will be back. Their grand opening is posted for Jan 12 with specials if you've seen them on social media and we're considering giving them a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dole whip small size
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon DIY bowl at home

BNsk0vwCt_H2iktnWOF5yw.text: Ohh my deliciousness. This place is .  When you enter, you are smacked right in the face with the cleanest and most delicious smelling ingredients.  The cleanliness and service are impeccable. You can see the care and attention to detail from the greeting when you enter to ordering your meal. The GM is the nicest guy!! So kind, helpful and quick.  It's my second visit in 2 days and I feel like I could come get lunch here again tomorrow.  A real gem find!

Dja_our63NuftC3OrLNJkQ.text: First time having a poke bowl and I was quite impressed. It is kind of pricey for a lunch option though. Granted a sushi roll at a Japanese restaurant is $12-$15 and being able to build your bowl and choose 4 proteins makes it seem better. I ended up spending $17 on a build your on poke bowl + the Hawaiian drink they offered that is non carbonated. The staff was very kind and welcoming! I'll have to really crave a poke bowl to want to go back. However, I will treat myself to their dole whip occasionally.

photos.caption: Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. They offer Hawaiian drinks + poke.
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Built my own poke bowl.
Photo of Pokeatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious
